motions.title: Consent Agenda Approval
motions.description: Approval of consent agenda including: • July 11, 2022, City Council special called meeting minutes • July 11, 2022, City Council meeting minutes • Project agreement with Georgia Department of Transportation for North Shallowford Road Path Project • Contract with TSW for final design of gateway signage • Authorize the purchase of replacement firearms for Police Department

motions.title: Approval of Qualified Agencies for American Rescue Plan Funding
motions.description: Approval of qualified list of twelve agencies for American Rescue Plan funding (six that received CARES funding and six with facilities usage agreements with city or operate on city property).

motions.title: Authorize Specialized Unit Pay for Police Department
motions.description: Approval of specialized unit pay for the police department.

specialEvents.title: Presentation of Carnegie Medal to Family of Kim A. McGrady
specialEvents.description: Presentation of North America's highest honor for civilian heroism to family of Kim McGrady, who lost his life saving three people caught in riptide in Miramar Beach, Florida on April 8, 2021.

presentations.title: Report of Capital Committee
presentations.description: Committee consensus was no need for bond referendum in 2022. Committee voted 2-1 to recommend not moving forward with list for bond referendum in 2023. Discussion on continuing work for potential 2024 referendum.

discussionItems.title: Dunwoody Road Sidewalk Construction Bids
discussionItems.description: Sol Construction, LLC submitted low bid of $549,111 for sidewalk construction on Dunwoody Road and Chamblee Dunwoody Road at Oakpointe Place. Staff recommends award with 10% contingency.

discussionItems.title: Contract Award of Consulting Services for Study of Police Department
discussionItems.description: Review committee recommends award to BerryDunn for flat fee not-to-exceed $117,500. Study estimated to take eight months.

discussionItems.title: Request Approval for Disposal of Seized Property
discussionItems.description: Police department received court order to dispose of seventy-three seized firearms. Seven returned to owners, requesting approval to dispose of sixty-six in accordance with state law.

discussionItems.title: Request Approval for Disposal and Transfer of Obsolete Equipment
discussionItems.description: Request to surplus seventy expired Security Pro rifle plates and thirty-six armored helmets that no longer meet National Institute of Justice ballistics standards for transfer to DeFuniak Springs Police Department.
